required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 09, 2023
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Research Study Looking at the Safety of Multiple Doses of ZP8396 and How it Works in the Body of Healthy Participants
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Multiple Ascending Dose Trial Assessing Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics, and Pharmacodynamics of ZP8396 Administered to Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The trial is a single-centre, randomised and double-blind within cohorts, placebo-controlled, sequential multiple ascending dose trial in normal weight and overweight but otherwise healthy subjects randomised to subcutaneous administration of ZP8396 or placebo

detailed_description.textblock:
The research study will investigate the safety and tolerability of ZP8396 in healthy study participants. In addition, the study will investigate how ZP8396 works in the body (pharmacokinetics and pharmacodynamics).
Participants will receive 6 once-weekly doses as an injection under the skin (subcutaneous, s.c.).
Participants will have 14 visits with the study team. 6 of these visits consists of overnight stays of different duration (2-4 nights) at the study site. For each participant, the study will last up to 116 days.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A single-centre, placebo-controlled, double-blind (within cohorts), randomised multiple ascending dose trial.
study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of treatment emergent adverse events (TEAEs)
primary_outcome.time_frame: From dosing (Day 1) to end of trial (Day 92)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve over a dosing interval. Samples will be taken at set time points throughout the trial.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to infinity. Samples will be taken at set time points throughout the trial.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero to the time of the last measurable concentration. Samples will be taken at set time points throughout the trial.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Maximum (peak) plasma drug concentration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Time to reach maximum (peak) plasma concentration

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Elimination rate constant

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Elimination half-life

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent volume of distribution

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Apparent total clearance of the drug from plasma

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Trough concentration measured pre-dose

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Accumulation Ratio for AUCτ

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Day 1 (pre-dose) to Day 92
secondary_outcome.description: Accumulation Ratio for Cmax

arm_group.description: Up to 3 dose cohorts are planned with 10 subjects in each; 7 participants in each cohort will receive active treatment.
In each of the 3 dose cohorts, 3 subjects will receive placebo.

intervention.description: Participants will receive 6 once-weekly doses of ZP8396 given subcutaneously (s.c., under the skin). Dose level will depend on the cohort.
Participants will receive 6 once-weekly doses of placebo given subcutaneously (s.c., under the skin).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Body Mass Index (BMI) between 21.0 and 29.9 kg/m^2, both inclusive
- Glycosylated hemoglobin (HbA1c) below 5.7 percent
- Further inclusion criteria apply
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of metabolic diseases more frequently associated with obesity, e.g. type-2-diabetes mellitus, hypertension, dyslipidemia, heart disease or stroke
- Systolic blood pressure below 90 mmHg or above139 mmHg and/or diastolic blood pressure below 50 mmHg or above 89 mmHg
- Symptoms of arterial hypotension
- Further exclusion criteria apply
